author: parithosh
content:
Regarding testnet timelines, Considering quite a few people will be busy with interop next week - would everyone be okay with having the public testnet(Zhejiang) post interop? The main reason for this, is that we want to avoid spending time on user support during the even (as rightfully pointed out by Paul). 

In lieu of this, we'd like to keep withdrawal-devnet-3 up until the public testnet is out. We'd be doing a mainnet shadow fork next week, we can do some intense testing and fuzzing on that. Additionally we can do scenario testing, such as filling up BLS changes pre/post capella or non-finality during the fork, etc. This should also allow us to have more stable releases out for the public testnet. 

In case someone is strongly against this approach, do let us know and we can re-plan things if needed.

author: marioevz
content:
Hi all, we have a new page dedicated to the withdrawals interop test suite in hive:
https://hivewithdrawals.ethdevops.io/

The goal is to run every test case using two different CL clients at a time and a single reference EL to be able to better determine which client combinations are failing.
Same approach for EL clients, with two different clients at the same time using a single reference CL.

CL Combinations are as follows:
```
lighthouse+teku+geth
lighthouse+prysm+geth
lighthouse+nimbus+geth
lighthouse+lodestar+geth
teku+prysm+geth
teku+nimbus+geth
teku+lodestar+geth
prysm+nimbus+geth
prysm+lodestar+geth
nimbus+lodestar+geth
```
EL Combinations
```
geth+nethermind+lighthouse
geth+erigon+lighthouse
geth+besu+lighthouse
nethermind+erigon+lighthouse
nethermind+besu+lighthouse
erigon+besu+lighthouse
```

The suite currently contains four testnets each testing a different scenario, which are all described in this page (only the first 4 at the moment):
https://github.com/ethereum/hive/tree/eth2-withdrawals-interop/simulators/eth2/withdrawals

This is an alternative branch of hive (https://github.com/ethereum/hive/tree/eth2-withdrawals-interop) which is not contained in master yet.

In this same branch you can find in `./clients/*/Dockerfile` the docker image currently used for this run for each client, so if there is any that needs an update just let me know or submit a PR to this branch.

All latest updates are included in this branch: Wei-to-Gwei, latest consensus spec, BLS-to-execution signature using genesis.
